channel.title: briefUpdatesPoliticsOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesPoliticsOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Smartphones at age 12 linked to worse health
item.description: Preteens who own smartphones are likelier to have depression, obesity and insufficient sleep than their peers, according to a new University of Pennsy...

item.title: Trump says he's picked who he wants to lead the Fed
item.description: President Trump said Sunday he's decided who he'll nominate to be the next Federal Reserve chair, but he wouldn't be drawn on whether the pick is Nati...

item.title: Behind the Curtain: Volatility vortex
item.description: Every president back to Bill Clinton enjoyed full party control of Congress and fantasized about lasting, durable governing dominance. Every president...

item.title: Post-war borders dominated "intense" U.S.-Ukraine talks

item.title: Here's what would make Bill Gates support dimming the sun to stop climate change

item.title: Trump says Hegseth denied issuing order to kill boat crew
item.description: The president also said he would not have wanted a second strike on a boat allegedly carrying drugs, which occurred after U.S. forces realized the ini...

item.title: The forgotten court case that let billionaires spend big on elections
item.description: While Citizens United became shorthand for unlimited political spending, SpeechNow never even made it to the Supreme Court but made super PACs a reali...

item.title: What we know about the National Guard shooting in D.C.

item.title: GOP faces a familiar dilemma: What to do about Obamacare?
item.description: Republicans are racing to craft health-care plans ahead of a planned vote, as deadline looms on soon-to-expire Affordable Care Act subsidies.

item.title: White House bullish on economic growth as Thanksgiving spending rises
item.description: Economic adviser Kevin Hassett dismissed economic bedwetters, saying strong spending bodes well for the economy.

item.title: Hegseth conscripts the Pentagon for Trump’s ‘retribution campaign’
item.description: In threatening to deploy the military justice system against Democrats, Hegseth has joined Trump’s norm-shattering bid to punish political foes.

item.title: Trump, stung by Republican losses, stands his ground on affordability
item.description: Democrats running on cost-of-living anxieties outperformed Republicans in Tuesday’s elections by greater-than-expected margins. The president chalked ...

item.title: Voters on Tuesday rewarded Democrats who addressed economic costs. Hours later, Trump said he delivered an 'economic miracle.'
item.description: A recent poll found a majority of Americans feel they’re spending more on groceries than they did a year ago.

item.title: Reaganomics in Jersey: Jack Ciattarelli has a supply-side dream if he’s elected governor this week
item.description: The Republican nominee has promised tax cuts and economic growth, but the numbers are fuzzy.

item.title: Silicon Valley Is Raving About a Made-in-China AI Model
item.description: DeepSeek is called “amazing and impressive” despite working with less-advanced chips.

item.title: Tech, Media & Telecom Roundup: Market Talk
item.description: DeepSeek, SoFi and more in the latest Market Talks covering Technology, Media and Telecom.

item.title: What to Know About China's DeepSeek AI
item.description: The Chinese upstart says it has trained high-performing AI models cheaply, without using the most advanced chips.

item.title: Reid Hoffman Raises $24.6 Million for AI Cancer-Research Startup
item.description: The LinkedIn co-founder is starting Manas AI with “The Emperor of All Maladies” author Siddhartha Mukherjee.

item.title: Can an App Replace a Personal Trainer? I Tested Nearly a Dozen to Find Out
item.description: Apps can add flexibility and freshness to your routine. Just try not to get injured.
